availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Edward S. Duncanson, Sr. (Lexington, Kentucky, banker and notary public)

body.p: Lexington, Kentucky, banker and notary public. Virginia native. Married to Catherine Duncanson. Father of E. S. Duncanson, Jr., Mary Duncanson, Alice Duncanson, and Kate Duncanson. Owned four enslaved persons in 1860. Clerk of the First National Bank of Lexington in 1860. Bookkeeper of the First National Bank of Lexington in 1865. Notary public in Fayette County, Kentucky, in 1865.

bibl.p: Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedule, Kentucky, Fayette County, Lexington, p. 101; Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedule, Kentucky, Fayette County, Lexington, Ward 4, p. 5; Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedule, Kentucky, Fayette County, Lexington, Ward 4, p. 54; KYR-0001-007-0379.
